Claims Processing.title: Submit EDI 837-P Claims
Claims Processing.description: As a behavioral health provider, I want to submit HIPAA-compliant EDI 837-P claims for outpatient behavioral health services, so that I can be reimbursed for services provided to patients while ensuring compliance with federal regulations
acceptance_criteria: System accepts claims with valid NPI/Tax ID (verified via NPPES registry)
System validates CPT codes against BH-specific NUCC taxonomy (e.g., 261QM0850X)
System rejects claims missing required loops (e.g., Loop 2010AA for provider info per X12 837-P TR3)
System logs submission timestamps for 42 CFR Part 2 audit trails
System validates Place of Service (POS) codes (e.g., POS 02 for telehealth per CMS MLN909432)
System flags potential duplicate claims based on NCCI MUE thresholds for H-codes
Claims Processing.regulatory_reference: HIPAA, 42 CFR Part 2, CMS MLN909432, NCCI

Pre-authorization Workflows.title: Pre-Authorization Request Submission
Pre-authorization Workflows.description: As a healthcare provider, I want to submit a pre-authorization request for a patient's services, so that the patient's insurance coverage can be verified before treatment.
acceptance_criteria: The system should allow providers to submit pre-authorization requests electronically.
The system should validate all required fields in the pre-authorization request.
The system should provide immediate feedback to the provider upon submission.
The system should track the status of all pre-authorization requests.

Pre-authorization Workflows.title: Pre-Authorization Clinical Review
Pre-authorization Workflows.description: As a clinical reviewer, I want to review pre-authorization requests and determine medical necessity, so that I can make informed decisions about approving or denying services.
acceptance_criteria: The system should provide a clear and concise view of the pre-authorization request information.
The system should provide access to the patient's medical records.
The system should allow clinical reviewers to document their review and decision.
The system should track the clinical review process and timeline.
Pre-authorization Workflows.stakeholders: Clinical reviewers, healthcare providers, insurance payers

Pre-authorization Workflows.title: Pre-Authorization Business Rules Engine
Pre-authorization Workflows.description: As a system administrator, I want to configure business rules to automate pre-authorization decisions, so that the process is efficient and consistent.
acceptance_criteria: The system should allow administrators to define and manage pre-authorization rules.
The system should apply the rules automatically to incoming pre-authorization requests.
The system should provide reporting and auditing of the rule application process.
The system should be flexible and adaptable to changing business needs.

Pre-authorization Workflows.title: Pre-Authorization Notification
Pre-authorization Workflows.description: As a healthcare provider, I want to receive notification of the pre-authorization decision, so that I can inform the patient and proceed with treatment.
acceptance_criteria: The system should provide immediate notification to the provider upon decision.
The notification should include the decision, rationale, and any additional information.
The notification should be delivered electronically via secure channels.

Pre-authorization Workflows.title: Pre-Authorization Code Generation
Pre-authorization Workflows.description: As a system, I want to generate unique authorization codes for approved pre-authorization requests, so that these codes can be used to track utilization and billing.
acceptance_criteria: The system should generate unique, alphanumeric codes for each approved request.
The codes should be easily identifiable and trackable.
The codes should be securely stored and accessed.
Pre-authorization Workflows.stakeholders: System administrators, insurance payers, billing staff

Provider Data Management.title: Onboard a new provider
Provider Data Management.description: As a provider enrollment specialist, I want to onboard a new provider into the system, so that they can begin submitting claims.
acceptance_criteria: The system should collect all required provider information (name, address, NPI, taxonomy codes, etc.)
The system should validate the NPI against the NPPES database
The system should verify the provider's taxonomy codes
The system should store the provider's information securely and accurately

Provider Data Management.title: Credential a provider
Provider Data Management.description: As a credentialing specialist, I want to credential a provider, so that they can be verified and approved to submit claims.
acceptance_criteria: The system should allow for the upload of all necessary credentialing documents
The system should track the status of the credentialing process
The system should notify the provider of the credentialing status
The system should ensure that all credentialing requirements are met before approving the provider

Provider Data Management.title: Validate NPI
Provider Data Management.description: As a system administrator, I want to validate the NPI of a provider, so that I can ensure the accuracy of provider data.
acceptance_criteria: The system should verify the NPI against the NPPES database in real-time
The system should provide feedback to the user if the NPI is invalid
The system should handle NPI validation errors gracefully
The system should log all NPI validation attempts

Provider Data Management.title: Maintain taxonomy codes
Provider Data Management.description: As a provider, I want to maintain my taxonomy codes, so that my services are accurately categorized and reimbursed.
acceptance_criteria: The system should allow providers to view and update their taxonomy codes
The system should validate taxonomy codes against a current taxonomy code list
The system should provide feedback to the provider if the taxonomy codes are invalid
The system should prevent providers from entering duplicate taxonomy codes

System Rules & Business Requirements.title: HIPAA Compliance for Claims Submission
System Rules & Business Requirements.description: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that all claims submissions comply with HIPAA regulations, so that we avoid penalties and maintain patient privacy.
acceptance_criteria: All claims data is encrypted during transmission and storage
Claims data includes only necessary patient information
Access to claims data is restricted to authorized personnel
Audit trails are maintained for all claims submissions and access

System Rules & Business Requirements.title: CMS Program Integrity Compliance
System Rules & Business Requirements.description: As a claims processor, I want to ensure that all claims comply with CMS program integrity requirements, so that we avoid payment denials and maintain compliance.
acceptance_criteria: Claims are screened for potential fraud, waste, and abuse
Claims data is validated against CMS guidelines
Appropriate documentation is maintained for all claims
Regular audits are conducted to monitor compliance

System Rules & Business Requirements.title: 42 CFR Part 2 Compliance for Substance Use Disorder Information
System Rules & Business Requirements.description: As a behavioral health provider, I want to ensure that all substance use disorder information is handled in compliance with 42 CFR Part 2, so that patient confidentiality is maintained.
acceptance_criteria: Access to substance use disorder information is restricted to authorized personnel
Substance use disorder information is not disclosed without patient consent
Appropriate safeguards are in place to protect substance use disorder information
Audit trails are maintained for all access to substance use disorder information

System Rules & Business Requirements.title: NCCI Edits and MUE Threshold Compliance
System Rules & Business Requirements.description: As a claims processor, I want the system to automatically check claims against NCCI edits and MUE thresholds, so that we avoid payment denials and ensure accurate billing.
acceptance_criteria: Claims are automatically checked against current NCCI edits and MUE thresholds
Claims with errors are flagged for review and correction
Reports are generated to track NCCI edit and MUE threshold violations

System Rules & Business Requirements.title: Audit Trail for Healthcare Data
System Rules & Business Requirements.description: As a compliance officer, I want a comprehensive audit trail for all healthcare data, so that we can track access, modifications, and deletions.
acceptance_criteria: All access, modifications, and deletions of healthcare data are logged
Audit logs include timestamps, user IDs, and details of the actions performed
Audit logs are securely stored and protected from unauthorized access
Audit logs are regularly reviewed and analyzed
